meanings.definition: To examine or treat by means of X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The doctor radiographed the patient's broken arm to see the fracture.
meanings.sent2: The dentist radiographed the tooth to check for cavities.
meanings.sent3: The detective radiographed the mysterious package to uncover its contents.
meanings.sent4: The scientist radiographed the ancient artifact to reveal its hidden symbols.
meanings.sent5: The technician radiographed the machine to identify the faulty part.

meanings.definition: To produce an image of the internal structure of an object using X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The technician radiographed the car engine to find the source of the problem.
meanings.sent2: The hospital radiographed the patient's chest to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The artist radiographed the flower to create a unique piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist radiographed the ancient ruins to map out the hidden chambers.
meanings.sent5: The engineer radiographed the bridge to ensure its structural integrity.
